river_segment Struct Reference

A segment of the river in the model. More...

#include <crisp.h>

List of all members.

Public Attributes

river_segment * fork
 Main branch upstream for the river.
river_segment * down
 Fork (if any) to a second upstream segment.
river_segment * next
 Link back downstream.
tributary * tributaries
 The tributaries that attach to this segment, in order from downstream to upstream, linked by their "trib_list" pointers.
char * river_name
 Name of the river of which this segment is a part.
char * seg_name
 Name of this segment.
char * abbrev
 Abbreviated name of this segment.
int seg_type
 Type of this segment using the following:
  • DAM_SEG
  • POWERHOUSE_SEG
  • REACH_SEG
  • HEADWATER_SEG.

unsigned int output_flags
 Runtime output flag field.
unsigned int output_settings
 Stored output settings (for selecting sections of output.
union {
   struct dam {
      struct dam_species {
         float   bypass_mort
 Mortality in conventional spillways.
         float   sluiceway_mort
 Mortality in the bypass.
         float   turbine_mort
 Mortality in the sluiceway.
         float   transport_mort
 Mortality in the turbines.
         float   rsw_mort
 Mortality in transport.
         float   mean_forebay_transit_time
 Mortality in the RSWs.
         float   separation_prob
 In hours, for forebay pred mort.
         float   pred [DAM_TIME_SLC]
 Chance of non-collection during a transport operation.
         float   pred_pop_mean
 Predation given at each dam time slice.
         float   pred_pop_tailrace
 Predation population in the forebay.
         equation   spill_eqn
 Predation population in the tailrace.
         equation   fge_eqn
 Spill equation to determine the proportion of fish routed to spillways (both conventional and RSW).
         equation   trans_eqn
 Fish guidance efficiency for determining the proportion of non-spilled fish routed through the bypass system.
         equation   delay_eqn
 Delay equation that determines delay of fish at a dam depending on species, time of day, season, and flow (relative to hydraulic capacity).
         float   sluiceway_prop
 Proportion of non-spilled fish that pass through SBC or sluicway.
         float   night_fge
 Day time FGE.
         float   spill_delay
         float   bypass_delay
 Extra delay for fish entering conventional spillways.
         float   sluiceway_delay
 Extra delay for fish entering bypass system.
         float   turbine_delay
 Extra delay for fish entering sluiceway.
         float   rsw_delay
 Extra delay for fish entering turbines.
         float   spill_day
 Extra delay for fish entering RSW.
         float   bypass_day
 Extra delay for fish arriving during the day when entering conventional spillways.
         float   sluiceway_day
 Extra delay for fish arriving during the day when entering bypass system.
         float   turbine_day
 Extra delay for fish arriving during the day when entering sluiceway.
         float   rsw_day
 Extra delay for fish arriving during the day when entering turbines.
      }   species

      float   powerhouse_capacity
 Total number of powerhouses.
      float   width
 Capacity in KCFS of this powerhouse.
      float   tailrace_length
 Tailrace width (ft).
      float   base_elev
 Tailrace length in ft.
      float   fb_elev
 Dam floor elevation (ft).
      float   tr_elev
 Forebay elevation (ft).
      float   fp_head
 Tailrace elevation (ft).
      float   fp_fb_depth
 Full pool head.
      float   bypass_height
 Full pool forebay depth.
      int   collector
 Height of bypass orifice.
      float   ngates
 Whether or not this dam is a collector dam.
      float   gate_width
 Number of spill gates.
      float   pergate
 Width of each gate (ft).
      float   spillway_width
 Max spill per gate.
      float   basin_length
 Spilway width.
      float   sgr
 Stilling basin depth.
      float   spill [DAM_SLICES_IN_SEASON]
 Specific grav of roller.
      float   planned_spill [DAYS_IN_SEASON *DAM_TIME_SLC]
 Planned spill vector is computed from planned_spill days/nights, then serves as inpute to compute_flow().
      PERIOD_LIST *   planned_spill_night
 Planned spill during the day.
      PERIOD_LIST *   legacy_planned_spill
 Planned spill during the night.
      PERIOD_LIST *   legacy_fish_spill
 Planned spill during the day.
      float   spill_cap
 Planned spill during the day.
      FlowLocation   spill_side
 Maximum unforced spill (kcfs).
      float   flow_max
 Left bank or right bank.
      float   flow_min_project
 For slider top-end.
      float   flow_min_river
 User data; used by modulators.
      float   flow [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Calculated from river desc.
      river_segment *   additional_pwrhs
 Flow in KCFS given at each day.
      int   phouse_priority
 Pointer to additional powerhouse if it exists.
      PERIOD_LIST *   phouse_schedule
 Ranking of each phouse.
      float   flow_fraction [DAM_SLICES_IN_SEASON]
 The threshold and schedule are used at run time to determine the actual percentage flow through this powerhouse, tracked here as flow_fraction.
      transport *   transport
 Storage basin (may be NULL).
      GasDistribution *   gas_in
 Transport operation (this may be NULL) information.
      GasDistribution *   gas_out
 Gas distribution input.
      float *   initial_gas
 Gas distribution output.
      equation   nsat_eqn
 Only defined if there is an initial gas vector which supercedes any in-river gas.
      equation   nsat_night_eqn
 Nitrogen supersaturation equation that determines the production of gas during day hours.
      equation   nsat_backup_eqn
 Nitrogen supersaturation equation during night hors.
      float   gas_theta
 Nitrogen supersaturation equation for when the spill fraction drops out of the range in which the day and night equations reasonably model behavior.
      float   k_entrain
 Mixing parameter.
      float   forebay_depth [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Powerhouse side gas entrainment.
      float   tailrace_depth [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Forebay depth at each day.
      float   drop_ratio [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Tailrace depth at each day.
      float   tr_drop_ratio [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Drop ratio.
      float   daylight_proportion [DAM_SLICES_IN_SEASON]
 Drop ratio for the tailrace.
      float   water_temp [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Proportion of the day that is light given at each dam time slice.
      int   init_temp_flag
 Water temperature given at each model time step.
      float   turbidity [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 1 if input_temp = "0N" (reading temperatures), 0 if "Off"
      int   turbidity_flag
 Turbidity at each model time step.
      float   rsw_spill_cap
 1 if input_turb = "0N" (reading turbidity), 0 if "Off" (propegate from above)
   }   dam

   struct reach {
      struct reach_species {
      }   species
 Species-specific parameters for reaches.
      struct reach_species {
      }   spec
 Species-specific parameters for reaches.
      float   length
 Reach class number which should be on [0.
      float   volume
 Length of segment in miles.
      float   surface_area
 Volume at max reservoir level; ft^3.
      float   width
 Average; ft^2.
      float   depth
 Average; ft.
      float   upper_depth
 Average max; ft.
      float   lower_depth
 Max at upper end of reach; ft.
      float   lower_elev
 Max at lower end of reach; ft.
      float   slope
 Height above sea level, or bottom of river at the lower end of reach; ft.
      float   elev_change [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Angle of sides, from vertical; deg.
      float   cur_volume [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Delta from max.
      float   velocity [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Current volume.
      float   flow_max
 Current velocity.
      float   flow_min
 For slider top-end.
      float   flow [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Summed from headwaters.
      GasDistribution *   gas_in
 Flow given at each day.
      GasDistribution *   gas_out
 Input gas distribution.
      float   gas_theta
 Output gas distribution.
      float *   initial_gas
 Mixing parameter.
      equation   gas_dist_eqn
 This equation is not actually stored in data files; it is included only for insight into gas distribution mechanisms.
      float   loss_min
 Maximum loss at this reach.
      float   loss [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Minimum loss at this reach.
      float   water_temp [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Loss given at each day.
      float   delta_temp [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Water temperature at each model time step.
      int   init_temp_flag
 Modifies water_temp.
      float   turbidity [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 1 if input_temp = "0N" (reading temperatures), 0 if "Off"
      int   turbidity_flag
 Turbidity given at each model time step.
      float   pred_dist_coef
 1 if input_turb = "0N" (reading turbidity), 0 if "Off" (propegate from above)
      float   water_particle_tt
 "Predator distribution coefficient" - used in V1.6 pred/vol interaction.
   }   reach
 Reach/reservoir-specific parameters.
   struct headwater {
      float   flow_max
 For unregulated flow.
      float   flow_min
 For slider top-end.
      float   flow [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 For modulation or propagation.
      float   elev_change [DAYS_IN_SEASON]
 Flow given at each day.
      GasDistribution *   gas_out
 Delta from max.
      float *   initial_gas
 Output gas distribution.
      float   water_temp [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Only defined if there is an initial gas vector which supercedes any in-river gas.
      float   turbidity [STEPS_IN_SEASON]
 Water temperature at each model time step.
      int   turbidity_flag
 Turbidity at each model time step.
      float   flow_mean
 1 if input_turb = "0N" (reading turbidity), 0 if "Off" (propegate from above)
   }   headwater
 Headwater-specific parameters.
} current
 This union stores the type-specific information about a river segment.

} run [NRUNS]
 This union stores the type-specific information about a river segment.

Detailed Description

A segment of the river in the model.

River segments are probably the most important data structure in the entire model since they represent the river and all of its tributaries as well as headwaters. Segments may be dams, extra powerhouses, reaches, or headwaters.

All river segments form a tree with the global river_mouth segment being the root of the tree. Segments may have up to 2 children using the up and fork fields. All segments in the model are linked together in no partiular order using the next field.

Member Data Documentation

unsigned int river_segment::output_settings

Stored output settings (for selecting sections of output.

see summary.c and Output Settings in COMPASS for more information)

equation river_segment::delay_eqn

Delay equation that determines delay of fish at a dam depending on species, time of day, season, and flow (relative to hydraulic capacity).

Yield a passage probability. Note that this has been mostly superseded by the newer dam delay model that allows for simulating diel passage. See See the Word document on the new dam delay algorithm.

float river_segment::spill_delay

See the Word document on the new dam delay algorithm

New dam delay support that varies by passage route and day/night. The new dam delay mechanism allows extra delay for each route to be specified and then delay for each route that is only incurred during the day. This can be used to simulate diel passage.

This works by delaying a certain fraction of fish by whole number of days in order to have the whole group average a (probably fractional) amount of delay.

struct { ... } ::dam::dam_species * river_segment::species

Species-specific information at a dam (i.e.

the dam species parameters)

struct { ... } ::dam::dam_species * river_segment::spec

Species-specific information at a dam (i.e.

the dam species parameters)

float river_segment::powerhouse_capacity

Total number of powerhouses.

float river_segment::width

Average; ft^2.

float river_segment::ngates

Whether or not this dam is a collector dam.

(i.e. it has PIT tag detectors and a different kind of bypass system which can produce latent effects)

PERIOD_LIST* river_segment::legacy_fish_spill

Planned spill during the day.

This is used to implement support for legacy planned_spill and fish_spill tokens.

float river_segment::spill_cap

Planned spill during the day.

This is used to implement support for legacy planned_spill and fish_spill tokens.

PERIOD_LIST* river_segment::phouse_schedule

Ranking of each phouse.

The best priority is 0 followed by increasing positive numbers.

struct transport* river_segment::transport [read]

Storage basin (may be NULL).

GasDistribution* river_segment::gas_in

Transport operation (this may be NULL) information.

Drop ratio.

I'm not actually sure what this is.

float river_segment::daylight_proportion[DAM_SLICES_IN_SEASON]

Drop ratio for the tailrace.

I'm not actually sure what this is.

struct { ... } ::reach river_segment::reach

Reach/reservoir-specific parameters.

A reach is a segment of the actual river (where water flows).
